                  Tests of detectors repeatability 
---------------------------------------------------------------------
These tests are regression tests of cvtest system. The criterions of the detector repeatability implemented in these tests are described in "Scale & Affine Invariant Interest Point Detectors" and "A Comparison of Affine Region Detectors", Mikolajczyk et al.

Repeatability criterions:
1. repeating key points locations,
2. repeating regions. There are two cases:
   1.) scale invariant detector (the region is a circle),
   2.) affine invariant detector (the region is an ellipse). Repeatability for elliptic regions is not implemented in the tests yet (22.04.2010).

The tests run the detectors on the images taken from http://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/data/data-aff.html (as Mikolajczyk et al.).

---------------------------------------------------------------------
Source:
   opencv/tests/cv/src/adetectors.cpp

   CV_DetectorRepeatabilityTest is a base class for the detector repeatability test.
   CV_[detectorName]DetectorTest is a class for testing the corresponding detector.

Testdata:
   opencv_extra/testdata/cv/detectors/datasets contains 8 test sets (images and homography matrices ),
   opencv_extra/testdata/cv/detectors/algorithms contains xml-files with run parameters ( [detectorName]_params.xml ) and results of detector ( [detectorName]_res.xml ), that is detector repeatabilities on test images.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To run these tests
1. specify the test names in configure file of cvtest system. The test names:
   "repeatability-fast-detector"
   "repeatability-gftt-detector" (GFTT with useHarrisDetector == false)
   "repeatability-harris-detector" (GFTT with useHarrisDetector == false)
   "repeatability-mser-detector"
   "repeatability-star-detector"
   "repeatability-surf-detector"
2. run cvtest with -d and -f parameters, for example ./cvtest -d /home/opencv_extra/testdata/cv -f /home/cvcfg.xml

If there is not the file with run parameters for some detector in the directory opencv_extra/testdata/cv/detectors/algorithms, the default values of these parameters will be used and written in such file.
If there is not the file with results for some detector in the directory opencv_extra/testdata/cv/detectors/algorithms, the corresponding test will not be validate the results, but simply save them in such file.
